title: IRA - Discography (1989-2007) {mp3@VBR] [PL] Hard Rock
description:
IRA - Polish heavy metal band formed in 1987 in Radom by Jakub P?ucisz (guitar), Wojciech Owczarek (drums), Artur Gadowski (vocal, guitar), Dariusz Grudzie? (bass) and Grzegorz Wawrze?czuk (keyboards), during the fall of communism in Poland. They gained a wide popularity in Poland in the early nineties, mainly after releasing the "MÃƒÂ³j Dom" album, with the hit title song, which was still during their garage and semi-professional days. They also gained some local popularity amongst the Polish-speaking citizens in the United States, where they lived and worked for few months. After signing a professional contract back in Poland, they released a few albums which didn&#039;t prove to be commercially successful (except for the "MÃƒÂ³j Dom" follow-up, which was "IRA 1993"), and the band disbanded afterwards.
The name "IRA" comes from a latin word IRA, meaning anger (this was the band founders&#039; intention), however most people think they used an acronym for Irish Republican Army.

more on: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IRA_%28Polish_heavy_metal_band%29
